pros: Great. Flexible hours. A lot of opportunities to learn
cons: Sometimes a bit messy, and meetings at night

review_title: Suitable for a select few, Worst company to work for for the rest
pros: Brand name, work with smart individuals Acceptable compensation and benefits Good entry to middle level management
cons: Hire quick, fired fast without thinking of repercussions As an HR with over 10 years of experience, having worked a or supported a complex and diverse mix of organisations, this company is by far the worst and most messy organisation I have encounter - extremely bureaucratic and political - lacks transparency and all decision made from top management or a select few (usually c-levels) - zero sense of job security and extremely long working hours - everyone works for themselves - people who gets in early gets to stay people who gets in late gets the cut first - A company that lacks focus Perhaps by no fault of its own, it is a business to have yet to establish a sustainable business model Remote work and decentralised setting removes the sense of a company, team culture and brand identity No one whom I have spoke and work with in this company is truly happy and excited to be here

pros: able to work remotely. It can be a pros if you are a "quantity" person , it can be nightmare for you is you are a "quality" person Pioneer who became management here are the industry joke.
cons: Corrupt. Irresponsible staff with min experience got promoted or special treatment as long as they are"friend" with team lead. Don't join the firm if you from regulated FI background. You knowledges and experiences will be a waste here. Advise for those who regret " It's ok, if you feel this is wrong decision to join the firm, you can't change the firm culture, but you can change your life. Pls learn the lesson and find other job in a regulated (in good reputation country) firm. Advise for "team Lead", be humble, you will never know what will happen in future. Pls pray hard that you can stay in binance until retire or else you will never know who you will meet out there in future. With your experience, I am sure you cant survive out there.

review_title: It's ok if you never ever make a mistake or if you do, it is not obvious

Clearly nepotism is rampant, if you are not in favor with the ones that matter then you're basically out. Toxic workplace, worse if you are not Chinese native speaker or if you are not Caucasian.

pros: Flexible working place. Nice package.
cons: Bad working culture. Poor tech infra building. High communication cost.

review_title: No management on top, lots of middle and top management office politics
pros:
- Usually has biyearly benefits such as vouchers and anniversary gifts to employees
- Bonus is good compared to other industries but even then, its just comparable to crypto industry rates
- WFH and remote
cons:
- recent management or senior hires are not effective and creates more politics that trickles down from top to bottom
- EXCEPTIONALLY high turnover 
- CEO and Binance does things for PR but does not mean it and is not accountable e.g all the talks about r*gul***ns but efforts to implement is very slow 
- too much gatekeeping internally across teams due to politics on top; teams and functions are not collaborative and cannot share insights across teams 
- 80% of the early employees that grew Binance from 0 to 1000x has left 
- no transparency from top management and too secretive
- no onboarding and when you make mistakes, middle managers from other functions find fault in you first
- 995 culture 
- CEO says anything, everyone follows blindly and cannot question even if his decision doesnt make sense.

review_title: join for the brand, stay at your own will
pros: no red tape autonomy to make changes
cons: compliance culture is a facade. there is a fantastic team of compliance SMEs brought in to advise and lead management in the right direction but for some reason the senior executives have a mentality that they know better.

review_title: Bad actor in a good industry. Toxic culture. Work long hours for no reason. Bullying managers
pros: Flexibility in working from home. Monthly food and transport allowance (although tiny amount). Pay on par with industry average.
cons:
The company lacks basic respect of employees. Some incapable young leaders rose to the top just because they joined the firm early, but they have no idea how to lead. 

Result-driven culture just means crazy KPIs, and the company (all at least my team) expect most people standby and ready to work 7 days a week, including holidays, to do meaningless things. Some people slack during the day but start to message others during the night and Sundays, just to show they are hard working. 

After you join the company, you will be told not to tell your friend you are employed by Binance (except a few they granted exemption), because Binance hires lot of ppl from places they are not supposed to have operations. The contracting company you sign will also not be Binance or it's subsidiary, and it will just be one of the shell companies that the founding team created.

There are many grey areas this company operates in, and some areas are straightly illegal. You will be told you don't need to pay tax if you receive your compensation in BNB

 I strongly encourage you to do your own research before you decide to join. If you care about your long term career prospect, I would recommend you to join a more compliance crypto company (and there are many out there)

If you don't pass the test, you'll be out the door in less than an hour.

review_title: Couldn't pour water out of a boot even with instructions on the heel
pros:
- WFH
- Looks nice on your resume if you're intending to move around fintech
cons:
- Unrealistic KPI, centered management

- Only a handful of experienced hires that has relevant experience which you can't count beyond both hands, the remaining ones are blind leading the blind

The incumbents who got promoted to "team leads" are
- inexperienced; objectively assessing their skillset, they are equivalent to a junior analyst in a bank
- insecure; because of their incompetency they feel threatened when challenged, crab mentality 
- lack of accountability, fingers pointing
- poor communication skills, flip flop more than prata 
- lack of confliction resolution skills

 top of the heap or simply had no one else to promote?

Experienced hires who intend to join as junior/senior analyst, apply only if you can tolerate that your lead are as clueless as you and freshies who intend to join, apply only if you can tolerate that your lead tells you "I don't know" for most of the time. good luck

review_title: Rude, ill-mannered team leads, no basic manners
pros:
- wfh
- CEO is generous to the staffs
cons:
- the team leads are rude and inexperienced, just because they joined the company early, they are promoted to team leads but with the knowledge they have, can only survive in the fintech industry.

- scolding of vulgarities when they are angry cause they kana say or questioned by the higher ups / you don’t meet their target / you do wrongly

- Team Lead is just a “title” in the company, but actually you don’t need to have much knowledge to be a “team lead” in binance.  

- expect you to know how to do everything 

- turnover rate is very high

pros:
Fast pace environement and able to work with highly motivated talent individual.

Good benefit.
cons: Work life balance not as good

pros: Visionary leader - CZ. That's all.
cons:
The only worthy moment was the casual chats with CZ to understand his vision for the crypto industry and Binance. Apart from this, the rest of work environment is simply toxic. Some reasons:
1. The whole org is expanding too fast. CZ believes in decentralisation in work and it creates opportunists who take advantage of others' work or passing blame when things went wrong. HR team is incapable and the team hierarchy/structure do not promote any fair system to fully investigate most incidents. Results: Bad blood stays on, proliferate and continue to leech on new blood that onboard into Binance.
2. Plenty of incapable and toxic so-called young and promising leaders (just because they joined Binance at the early years thus trusted by the top). These are the people who would rotate to different teams and functions every quarter, arm with their incapabilities, only to find themselves staying afloat by doing the bare minimum and "talk" their way out. Result: Bad leaders stays, good team members lost faith and quit.
3. Toxic work cultures. They would sold the idea that people who work in Binance are "passionate", would be willing to clock in so many hours willingly. Due to peer pressure, most would conformed "or succumbed" to this and do the same, else risked your performance. Result: People burnt out or jeopardized their mental health, I've seen so many people quitting due to this and the HR or company do not simply care.
4. Self-proclaimed "innovative" and "user focused". But these values are determined top-down, the one on top and "louder" gets to say on what is innovative and what is user focused, not by the real facts. Result: Putting on a good show but the product experience improves very slowly.
5. People are rewarded for being unethical and smart (that's how you survived in an unregulated and unstructured work environment), or incapable and lucky (so you get trusted by your boss because you posed no threat to them). Result: I'm still seeing my incapable boss appearing in many of Binance events alongside ahem ** LOL).

Last note: If you are adventurous and thrive in unstructured work environment, passionate about crypto, enjoying non-worklife balance, "ruthlessly" smart - then this might be an ideal place for you.

pros: In the fintech industry there are many opportunities to learn and grow in the company.

pros:
- Flexible working hours and freedom to come and go.
- Great financial support to do our job.
- Some employees are passionate and hard-working (~40% of the company or less).
- Smart and talented people willing to share their knowledge.
- Company events and benefits.
- Very profitable and popular company.
- Fast-growing industry.
cons:
- Despite the flexible working hours, they move at a fast pace. Everything is treated as urgent. The number of new tasks and requests add up quickly. Quality is not a top priority.
- Lack of organization and poor communication makes the work hard at times. It's common to see redundant/repetitive work.
- The rating system is not always fair.
- There are some low-performers and inefficient people that should be replaced.

pros: Space to develop your own skill. Fast pace and can learn new things. Managers are great in terms of ambition and innovation. Great for someone who is passionate on crypto. Big name in the industry. Flexible working hours
cons: Normal working hour until 9pm, sometimes need to attend mid night meeting. A bit less professional, and people do not really know the importance of planning. Everything is treated as urgency, and workload management is not there

review_title: Unpredictable company - It can be positive or awful
pros: Good payment for role. Many possibilities to grow in the company. Multicultural environment.
cons: It is really hard to say whether working at Binance is positive or negative, because it really depends on the standard operations they implement for employees. Sometimes, they are fair and reasonable, and the job is rewarding. However, there can be months of extreme stress that might lead to mental health issues. This makes you think if the salary is worth it. Only after a lot of discontentment from the team they realize certain policies are terrible, but the damage is done. It surprises me that for such well educated people they implement stupid policies in order to reach KPIs that affect the quality of the service provided and the user experience. This goes against the company values but they insist

review_title: Worst experience ever in a company
pros: - Working remotely - two weeks training paid at the beginning
cons: - They don't mention that you need to pass a 2 weeks training during the job interview, some people are fired before they even start - No flexibility: Schedule for the next month published two days before, impossible to plan anything in your life as you can get a night shift or working during weekends and you will know it only two days before the next month starts. Employees are supposed to give their shift / free days preferences but they don't get it. - They favor quantity over quality - employees must take a high amount of live chats (can be 8 at the same time depending on volume at certain hours) which makes it super hard to reach KPI - even if Binance's mission is to democratize crypto we were ask to provide solution asap without more explanations to users - KPI are super hard to reach and unfair, you are just a number in this company. You are supposed to answer in 15s at the first message even though their system has latency. It is impossible to take a break if you have an active user (taking his laptop to the restroom was a habbit), rules are super strict and create competition / bad atmosphere within the team. - lot of turnover as per all the cons listed above - bad salary (salary is paid brut and in crypto so probably 3/4 of employees are not registered as freelance and don't pay their taxes) - Managers will always use soft skills to appease employees but they never take proper actions because "we are aware but we cannot do anything about it" - No life balance even though you're supposed to have more free time as it is a remote job - need to read 150+ notifications per day as per all updates from the system (3/4 of them are useless)

pros: - Leading crypto exchange in the world. - Higher pay than average, depends on years experience. - Big bonus, if you eligible. - Great benefits, lot of allowance. - WFA. Overall, great place to work for short term. Unless you are ambitious & workaholic person this is perfect place for you. Work hard , gain hard.
cons: - No work life balance & long hours. - High workloads, expect 1 person to do everything. - Micromanage, everything must be in very details. - Unrealistic KPI. - Complex politics & less transparency.

pros: High salary, supportive colleagues and efficient
cons: Working overtime is a must. Competitive culture

review_title: Not the company for those who like autonomy, trust and ownership
pros: Hugely ambitious, growing like rocket fuel, have a zeal for their crypto mission
cons: Shocking lack of trust - key pieces of data necessary to do one’s job are reluctantly shared No ability to get anything done and take ownership for getting something completed - a million cooks in every kitchen Cultish - very dystopian culture with people using aliases, cameras never turned on despite being a fully remote company, and people blindly and religiously following the world and org culture espoused by the Founder/CEO People claim to be working hard as that is what is expected (one of the company values is “hardcore”) but can’t see it from the actual results Hugely inefficient due to challenge of getting to the right people to involve in any project, due to the lack of availability of data, due to the lack of clear responsibilities and the lack of planning The lack of planning leads to complete cavalier attitudes to work life balance: you don’t hear from people from one week to the next, then late on a Friday night they will ping you saying they need something urgently for Monday morning - and it is clear they could have asked for this earlier in the week if they had thought through what they needed for 5 minutes….

review_title: Worst workplace if you have a bad manager
pros: work remotely, tax-free salary, access to internal data, largest trading volume exchange
cons:
- management here is horrible, especially your manager is come from Alibaba, they tried to bring everything in Alibaba to Binance without thinking whether it adapt
- manager doesn’t respect your holiday, they book meeting at night or holiday and asking why didn’t you reply immediately 
- time estimate here always `as soon as possible` and many `urgent task` would cut in line, the priority tags here are only p0 or no body cares
- base salary here just hit average, because CZ wants to reduce turnover rate, so they tried to allocate most of salary to yearly paid bonus. But the problem is your direct manager can have most of power to decide your bonus, if he/she don’t like you then you will not get a fair bonus … 
- last kpi here are more like a form, they didn’t do much experiments before setting goals, manager used to set reinvent a wheel with minor improve as their kpi … funny
- the worst thing is not being fool around, is to work like a headless chicken

review_title: Horrible ethics, manipulative and disgusting leadership. A "yes sir" company.
pros: A nice flourish to add to a resume
cons:
- Little to no vertical mobility.
- "promotions" are given without pay increases, increasing workload
- Unpaid overtime, which is expected of you every day. You will be expected to work nights, weekends and will not get compensated for such
- Manipulative HR practices. They will bully you and manipulate you if you do not agree with them and tell you that you aren't being a team player, or that you are acting aggressively towards them and then will refuse to discuss the issues raised
- The CEOs leadership has gone heavily downhill, and he now only seeks after employees who will only ever say 'yes'. Binance initially was about challenging ideas, but now it's about obedience.
- Company culture is toxic and there are too many politics.
- Unethical business practices, happy to put employees at risk to save themselves.
- Horrible compensation policies. They will continuously reduce bonuses but never increase salaries beyond ~3%/year (adjusting for inflation).
- Told managers that they would get fired if they did not get their teams to accept a new ETOP policy which resulted in employees having to forfeit significant amounts of money, or risk losing their jobs and risk getting their manager fired.
- Any reward or incentive will be revoked if there is 'too much upside', Binance's goal is to make sure employees are forever financially hungry, so they will never out-grow the company. However, all of the top contributors were financially free and contributed for passion rather than income, as a result, the top contributors quite often quit due to being disrespected by the company
- Binance will lock an employees Binance Exchange account if you do not agree with the leadership, even though they have no legal right to, they also like to play make-believe and confiscate employee funds if there is significant conflict. If you ever plan to take legal action against Binance, or ever speak to a lawyer, your account will be held hostage.
- Used to hold townhalls frequently until the questions asked by the employees got more and more negative as the companies practices got more and more toxic. Now townhalls don't happen.
- "Competitive Salary" = Below market salary. Most industry players offer much higher salaries.

pros: Europe management really tries to make it better but they cant handle china
cons:
I really dont recommend you to work at binance, unless you want to be stressed the full 8 hours of stressful work, not work recognition, not a career planning. 

It is really disappointing that a Chinese company in Europe has this kind of mentality and makes EU adjust to China like they want.

Management in Europe really tries to make it better but the one who takes the decision is the Chinese. 

It is a VERY stressful job with an insane workload, they implement new features on system almost daily and employees have to dig into and discover by a miracle while a customer is booming the chat as we have less than 5 seconds to reply, otherwise, bye bye bonus.

review_title: Dedicated, passionate and really cares for the employees.
pros:
Everyone that works at Binance is exceptionally passionate about the industry and dedicate so much of their time and effort to help the industry. The company culture is hugely inspirational. 
The work is always a challenging which is good for people that like to remain engaged and don't like to cruise through the day.
cons: The work/life balance suffers a little. However, this is mostly due to employee choice. Many Binance employees are incredibly passionate about this industry and Binance that they work long hours, sacrificing personal life. Everyone is free to come and go whenever they please, however, most stay longer than expected to help make a difference.

review_title: Passionate, caring and fun loving team with a clear vision
pros: The work we do is very meaningful and I am genuinely excited to come into work every day with such awesome colleagues and so much potential to be successful.
cons:
Fast moving and hard, challenging work. 
Stay away if you like to sit back and do little at work.
